newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila Central Bank sees lower interest rates.
newsitem.headline: Manila Central Bank sees lower interest rates.

text.p: Philippine Central Bank Treasurer Sergio Edeza said on Friday it could lower its key interest rate again.
"We think we should lower it again depending on the situation in the market. We think the situation three weeks ago has normalised," he told Reuters Financial Television.
Rates have recently been falling after reaching a two-year high in mid-May as the Bank defended the peso from speculative attack.
On Thursday, the Central Bank trimmed its overnight borrowing rate by two percentage points to 14 percent, the third cut in three weeks as the peso gained strength.
"The inflation numbers were favourable. That gives us confidence in lowering the rates again," he said.
On Thursday, the government reported that year-on-year inflation in May fell to a ten-year low of 4.2 percent compared with 4.6 percent in April.
Edeza added "We're looking at investment flows into the country and we think they're coming back."
